Another, perhaps more, interesting question to ask is - how many of those 2=
90 "REST" APIs are actually REST APIs? You know, the ones with hypermedia, =
discoverable resources, opaque URLs, and so on. Not just HTTP RPC SOAP in d=
isguise ...

/J=F8rn

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Sean Kennedy =

  To: Rest Discussion Group 
  Sent: Monday, January 23, 2012 7:01 PM
  Su=
bject: [rest-discuss] enterprise migration from WS-* to REST - report/study=
/survey...?


    

  Hi all,
       I have a presentation coming up and wa=
nt to make the case for the shift in the enterprise from WS-* to REST. Poin=
ts on my slide are:
    a.. Google SOAP Search API deprecated in 2006
    b=
.. Amazon SOAP API deprecated in 2011
    c.. www.programmableweb.com (last=
 60 days: 115 SOAP APIs registered versus 290 REST API's)
    d.. Informati=
onWeek survey (2009) where SOA implementation trend was towards REST from S=
OAP (http://www.informationweek.com/news/214501922)
  Are there other refer=
ences (bear in mind that I am in an academic arena and need quality referen=
ces). Is there a more recent report/survey than the 2009 one above?


  Man=
y thanks,
  Sean.
